page.title: 10THE MOAT FIELD IN SHAWBURY
page.content: The{Moat}is an area of low-lying land next to the{River Roden}in the village of Shawbury. In the Middle Ages it was a deep ditch filled with water surrounding a {manor house}-long since disappeared. Now the ditch is empty because it was drained, and overgrown,although children before the{1939-45 war}used to skate there on the ice in winter. { Daffodils}were planted to decorate the{Church}at{Easter}and this is still done.A vicar used to{bathe}in the pond which is alongside the river. There are many{trees,}mainly very old oaks.Owls and pigeons nest there, rabbits have burrows and foxes are heard at night. The Moat is about to become a{park. There will be benches and people will be able to walk and play there.
